alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 7:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT THURSDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban area and Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake and City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 731 PM EDT, Between 2 and 4.5 inches of rain fell earlier today. While the heaviest rain has ended, the threat for flooding will continue for at least the next few hours. Therefore, the FLash Flood Warning has been replaced by a Flood Warning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Kempsville, Regent University, Virginia Wesleyan University, Great Bridge, Deep Creek, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Princess Anne, Fentress, Norfolk International, Gallups Corner, Princess Anne Plaza, London Bridge, Mount Pleasant, Bayside, Greenbrier, Oceana NAS and Oceana. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Virginia Beach
